skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
Fighting upon an Arcane Phoenix, Teclis rides the magical tempests, harnessing the power of the howling Winds sweeping through the world of mortals.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.
The utmost concentration, the greatest attention to detail, are required if the world is to be saved from the destructive madness of the Ruinous Ones.
The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
As master of the foremost Asur mages, this Elf has studied in their secret libraries longer than most men live.

	(all characters)

skillTree.localised_description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

skillTree.localised_description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The caster utters words of power and a phoenix of pure fire manifests to swoop upon the enemy, bathing them in cleansing flame.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +2 for bound spell "Fireball"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.

"The Realms of Man must not fall. Our fate is intertwined with theirs, and if they fall, so too do we. For this reason, I taught their first masters of magic, and for this reason, we must not abandon Men, despite their barbarous ways."

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
“Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.”
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors
